pages.text: Pharyngolepis is a primitive jawless fish that had well developed anal and caudal fins. It did not have dorsal fins or paired fins so it was probably a poor swimmer, staying close to the seafloor. It had rows of bony spines, probably for protection against predators and it probably fed by scooping up food from the ocean floor.
